C# includes simple and effective memory: Does C# have memory management features? C# memory management features

The C# runtime manages this memory and ensures its efficient use. It does so through garbage collection, which automatically frees up memory no longer in use by the program. One way that C# manages memory is through the use of garbage collection.
Does C# have memory management features? C# memory management features

When a C# program runs, the operating system allocates memory for it. This memory stores data and objects created during the program's execution. The C# runtime manages this memory and ensures its efficient use. It does so through garbage collection, which automatically frees up memory no longer in use by the program.
